xai2cloud
part of the DrWhy.AI developed by the MI^2 DataLab 0.1.0

    • Deployment Tutorial

xai2cloud

A tool to create REST API from an explainer and deploy it to the cloud with just one R function.

Examples

  • [x] [Titanic (Random Forest) explainer](http://167.71.120.77/explain_titanic2/__swagger__/)
  • [x] [Covid-19 (gbm) explainer](http://167.71.120.77/sumodelcovid/__swagger__/)
  • [x] [Fifa (gbm) explainer](http://167.71.120.77/explain_fifa/__swagger__/)

Functionality

The main function is called plumb_exp(exp_name, droplet) which creates a REST API and a swagger for it based on the explainer. If you have an DigitalOcean account and a droplet with installed R 3.5+ it can also deploy the model directly to the cloud. At the time it supports three post/get functionalities:

  • Predict a result
  • Break Down plot
  • Ceteris Paribus plot
  • Break Down description
  • Ceteris Paribus description

How to use?

If you already have a DigitalOceanâs droplet with an appropriate R version (3.5+) or just want to plumb the explainer locally, skip the first section below.

How to create a new DigitalOcean droplet?

  1. If you donât have an account on DigitalOcean, create one here.
  2. Install development version of plumber R package by using install_github("trestletech/plumber")
  3. Install development version of analogsea R package by using remotes::install_github("sckott/analogsea")
  4. Create an SSH key and deploy i to DigitalOcean.
  5. Run analogsea::droplets() to check the connection to your DigitalOceanâs account.
  6. Run plumber::do_provision(). This will start a virtual machine (a new droplet) and install R with plumber.
  7. Access port 8000 on your dropletâs IP. If you see a response from plumber, everything works so far.

How to prepare your droplet?

  1. Access your newly created droplet (PuTTY guide for Windows) and update R version to 3.5 or higher.
  2. Access R on your droplet by typing R in (PuTTYâs) console.
  3. Update all outdated packages. You can use the update.packages() function.
  4. Install the following packages by using install.packages("package_name"):
    • DALEX
    • iBreakDown
    • ingredients
    • ggplot2
    • packages containing the models you are using (eg. gbm, randomForest)
  5. Your droplet is all set!

How to plumb the explainer?

Now you are ready to use the function plumb_exp(exp_name, droplet). It requires only two parameters:

  • exp_name - name of an .rda file containing an explainer or an explainer object
  • droplet - your DigitalOceanâs droplet number (check it by typing analogsea::droplets). If you wish to plumb it locally, set it to NA.
  • port - port that you would like to deploy your explainer to

DigitalOcean

If you put your dropletâs number as an argument, you have just deployed your explainer. You can access it at: your_droplet_ip/your_explainers_name/swagger/

Local

If you didnât put your dropletâs number, you have started the plumberâs swagger locally. You can access it at: http://127.0.0.1:port/__swagger__/
